instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Broken pad on logicboard - orange light but no power
threads.message: I have a water-damaged motherboard that had some corrosion around SMC. I replaced a couple of damaged caps and I'm getting an orange light on the charger but one of the pads on logicboard is damaged. I attached a photo. Any advice[ATTACH type="full"]60273[/ATTACH] on fixing it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Broken pad on logicboard - orange light but no power
threads.message:
Do you have good contact L/<CAPACITOR>C5001</CAPACITOR>?
Should get 3V there.

As always, reball SMC when note corrosion on its area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Broken pad on logicboard - orange light but no power
threads.message: I'm getting 3.4V on L5001 but not on <CAPACITOR>C5001</CAPACITOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Broken pad on logicboard - orange light but no power
threads.message:
Then run a wire L-<CAPACITOR>C5001</CAPACITOR>.
The pad is on the middle, but is just a test point, not important.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Broken pad on logicboard - orange light but no power
threads.message:
Thanks, I run a wire and now I'm getting 3.4 on pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C5001</CAPACITOR>. but still no power. 
I'm getting 8.18v on PPBUS__G3H
and I've 3.4V on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Broken pad on logicboard - orange light but no power
threads.message:
Did you reball SMC?
12MHz present at Y5110?
If no o-scope available, post DC voltage for crystal pins.
